text: Babis Bizas (born Charalampos Bizas, 16 September 1954) is a travel writer, explorer and tour operator, and the most traveled man on Earth. MSN - Lifestyle China Daily Kaleidoscope - The most traveled man on Earth He was born in Arta, Epirus, Greece. Babis Bizas - The Man He participated in an expedition to the North Pole in May 1996. Almost 18 years later, in December 2014, he landed in the South Pole, becoming that way probably the only one Greek to have visited both Poles. Dimitris Vlaikos Portfolios - Babis Bizas Babis Bizas in the South Pole - Recovered on 20-09-2020 By 2004 Bizas had visited all 194 sovereign countries of the world at that time. He is currently a member of the RGO (Russian Geographic Society) Русское географическое общество. National Geographic Traveler - Babis Bizas (In Dutch) - Recovered in 20-09-2020 Greeks of diaspora - Babis Bizas Cosmorama - Babis Bizas our own Magellan - Recovered from the prototype in 20-09-2020 ==Early life== He studied Political Sciences at the Panteion University of Social and Political Sciences in Athens and Slavonic languages in the Institute for Balkan Studies in Thessaloniki, where he learned Bulgarian and Russian. As a university student, he travelled as backpacker in Europe mostly hitchhiking and in 1977 he followed the stream of the young European travelers. Babis Bizas - Biography ==Books== Babis Bizas has written two travel books.
